title_narrative: Mine Action in Ukraine 2023 - 2026: Danish Refugee Council
Minhantering i Ukraina 2023-2026: Danish Refugee Council
sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
description_narrative:
The overall objective of the project is "Addressing the humanitarian impact of mines/ explosive ordnance on conflict-affected communities in Ukraine and enable early economic recovery." The project is implemented by Danish Refugee Council (DRC) during the period 1 September 2023 to 31 December 2026 and is a continuation of previous Sida support under the Sustainable Peace strategy since 2018. 

DRC's mine action operations in Ukraine includes most components of mine action including: non-technical survey, mine clearance/land release, Explosive Ordnance Risk Education, Victim Assistance as well as training and equipment for government entities.

Insatsen syftar till att minska de humanitära konsekvenserna av minor och andra explosiva lämningar samt att bidra till återhämtning och uppbyggnad av Ukraina. Insatsen implementeras av Danska flyktingrådet (DRC) under perioden 1 september 2023 till 31 december 2026. Insatsen bygger vidare på tidigare Sida-stöd till DRC:s minhanteringsverksamhet i Ukraina sedan 2018 och som då finansierades av Hållbar fred-strategin. 

DRC:s verksamhet innefattar kartläggning om förekomsten av minor och andra explosiva lämningar (så kallad non-technical survey), minröjning, riskutbildningar, stöd till minoffer samt stöd till nationella myndigheter med utrustning och utbildning till nationella myndigheter.

Overall objective:

Addressing the humanitarian impact of mines/explosive ordnance on conflict-affected communities in Ukraine and enable early economic recovery.

Objective 1: Improved safe access to land for displaced and conflict-affected communities in Ukraine

Objective 2: Increased resilience of at-risk populations through improved knowledge of explosive ordnance contamination and safe behaviours

Objective 3: Improved victim assistance response to support survivors of explosive ordnance accidents

Objective 4: Strengthened capacity of national stakeholders to respond to the risks posed by mines/explosive ordnance

Objective 5: Improved participation of women in mine action in Ukraine
result_description_narrative:
The following results have been achieved during the period 1 September 2023 to 31 October 2024:

- 151 Non-technical survey (NTS) reports completed 

- 58,466 square meters of mine contaminated land cleared and released 

- 20,141 people (women, girls, boys and men) have improved knowledge of Explosive Ordnance-related risks as well as safe behaviours via direct Explosive Ordnance Risk Education sessions

- 34 Explosive Ordnance survivors have received targeted individual assistance

- 25 metal detectors, 5 vehicles and office equipment provided to the Mine Action Center (MAC) in Ukraine

- 10 MAC staff were trained on NTS techniques

result_indicator_description_narrative: No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
